review_blob: Really good Oktoberfestbier. The dark amber colour makes this quite different from some of the others available. Very nice and malty, reminds me of James Squire amber but a bit less bitter and a bit more alcoholic.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob: This is one of my favourites. Available on tap at my local drinking hole where they consider this to be a dunkle weissbier on their menu. The head on this beer is so thick that it actually stands up and remains all the way through. The taste is very full and and slightly bitter. A++
Very nice beer. 500ml glass from Wirthaus unterhaching. Massive banana taste, more than many of the other weissbier varieties. Excellent bier
Not too bad, but was hoping for more flavour out of a higher alcohol bier. Has a little bit of a raspy taste. A little darker than normal Sparten Hell. Very little head retention from the pour.
Excellent Weissbier. Full flavoured and refreshing. Very light Amber colour with medium creamy white head. Would have again and keen to try other variations from Andechs
For an alcoholfrei this was surprisingly good. Best Ive had of the variety to date.
500ml bottle. Actually not too bad for a Bavarian Pils. Crisp bitterness and pleasant aftertaste.

On tap at Gasthaus zur Post, Unterhaching.
Very nice Pils. Probably one of the better Ive tried in bavaria. Nice bitterness, nice aroma. But I prefer the Augustiner Edelstoff over this still.

For a low alcohol beer this is quite drinkable. Smells quite hoppy and sweet and you call really taste the hops in this one, some good bitterness. As you drink it becomes less tolerable. I will try others before coming back to this one.

330ml bottle from a bottleshop in Wasserburg am Inn.

One of the better Bavarian Pils. Pleasant bitterness, nice refreshing taste, quality is there. Would have again
Another dissapointing Pils from Germany. Very hard to find a decent one. Falls behind Augustiner or Graf Ignaz in a long way. This one was not even very bitter which is a must for a Pils
500ml bottle. Smelled sour and tasted the same. Quite bitter, but not in a pleasent pilsner way. Ill keep away from this in the future

My favourite Aussie beer. 

Cloudy pale coloured beer, its not your typical pale ale. Not super charged with hops like american or indian pales, rather it is an easy drinking larger packed with flavour. 

From the bottle this beer must be rolled on its side before opening to get the full flavour of the beer. Otherwise it is a waste and not consumed in the way it was designed to be.

Not so much a sampler but one to drink over a session.

beer_brewer_name: Schneider Weisse G. Schneider & Sohn GmbH
review_blob:
500ml bottle and Schneider restaurant Munich

I tried this one off the back of its high rating on ratebeer and it didnt disappoint. Such a deep and complex taste of caramel, wheat, and a fruit. Dark brown in colour. Top notch

Bottle 500ml, purchased at the local bottle shop in Unterhaching.

What a surprise this beer was. Beautiful pale colour with pleasant sweet aroma of banana and hay. Probably the best weissbier Ive had to date, Great down to the last drop and demands another. Hard to beat

Bought from the local bottle shop in Unterhaching. 500ml Bottle.

Pours a brilliant head, with a darker than standard weissbier coloured liquid. Smells of bananas and bread, but the taste is a little less full compared to its other Bavarian compatriots. Slightly metallic. Okay, but had better.
